institution: Regents of the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor
award_title: Collaborative Research: IntBIO: Mammalian Tail Innovations & Variety Revealed By the Intersection of Genetics, Biomechanics, and Macroevolution
subject: Reusing code across collaborative labs
body:
Three-lab collaborations mean someone's scripts always break when shared. Phylogenetic models, biomechanical sims, genetic analysesâ€”different environments, dependency hell, methods that don't survive past publication.

Built Ouro so computational methods become reusable infrastructure, not just text in a methods section.

Happy to chat after the holidays if relevant.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
